title: Antitrust in the Data Age
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Antitrust in the Data Age.

hook.text: The US Department of Justice sued Google in 2020. The charge: monopolizing search through data dominance.

discovery.text: The new argument: data monopolies harm consumers through reduced choice, privacy loss, and innovation stifling.

twist.text: Google argued its dominance proves quality, not abuse. Users choose Google because it's the best.

punchline.text: Free products can still cost you too much.
